paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on genetic variants in the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mutation I104S in the human protein transthyretin (UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot ID: TTHY_HUMAN) is known to cause amyloidosis Type 1.
The mutation I104S in the human protein transthyretin (UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot ID: TTHY_HUMAN) is known to cause amyloidosis Type 1.
The mutation I104S in the human protein transthyretin (UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot ID: TTHY_HUMAN) is known to cause amyloidosis Type 1.

functional_data.summary: The I104S variant affects the stability of the TTR protein, leading to misfolding and amyloid formation.

variants.additional_notes: The I104S variant is one of the most studied variants in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The mutation I104S in the human protein transthyretin (UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot ID: TTHY_HUMAN) is known to cause amyloidosis Type 1.
